intro: Psychotria humensis, commonly known as the Amazonian morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Psychotria humensis is also notable for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids.
